*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, November 21, 1831. Suggestions for improvement of farm and home.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="11-21-1831">Novr 21. 1831*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Joel */person_mentioned*intends to go and see you which gives an opportunity to write*/p*
*p*lf *person_mentioned*Mrs Holley*/person_mentioned* wishes to come up I want the Dearborn to go into *location_mentioned*Bolivar */location_mentioned*after her, and as the *location_mentioned*road is bad through the bottom by *person_mentioned*Harris*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* I think you had better go in with it to *location_mentioned*Bolivar */location_mentioned*yourself and you can then have the iron work done, which is much needed or it well break worse— If *person_mentioned*Mrs Holley*/person_mentioned* does not wish to come up she will send word out to *person_mentioned*Mrs Bradleys */person_mentioned*for the Dearborn not to come in after her—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Dr. Angier*/person_mentioned* talks of going to *location_mentioned*Anahuac */location_mentioned*and perhaps you might trade your Horses to his *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*for her cattle—- *person_mentioned*John Austin */person_mentioned*says that cattle are falling, and I also think they are, and that they can be had cheaper by *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1832">Spring*/date_mentioned*—I shall leave here in a few days for *location_mentioned*Anahuac*/location_mentioned*, and from there I shall hire a boat and go direct to your place— you must then furnish me with horses to go to *location_mentioned*Bolivar */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Brazoria*/location_mentioned*— It probably will be *date_mentioned n="12-05-1831">two weeks*/date_mentioned* before I get to your *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*In the *location_mentioned*bend on the north or upper side of Pleasant Creek close to the timber some distance up the creek from its mouth*/location_mentioned* is very rich *location_mentioned*Shumac prairie*/location_mentioned* and a field there would be protected from the heavy winds from the sea which sometimes whip out the corn and blow it down*/p*
*p*I have spoken to *person_mentioned*Cap John Austin*/person_mentioned* for a number of orange fig and peach trees— you must be very particular to go into *location_mentioned*Brazoria*/location_mentioned* after them in *date_mentioned n="02-xx-1832">February*/date_mentioned*, also pomegranite— when you move down you can take peach trees as many as you want from here but get from all sides so as [to] have a greater variety— attend to this for a season lost in planting fruit trees is a great deal— from *location_mentioned*Bolivar */location_mentioned*you can get plums at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Henry*/person_mentioned*s*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*The place for the *location_mentioned*garden */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*orchard */location_mentioned*is on the *location_mentioned*South side of Pleasant Bayou*/location_mentioned* and it ought to be broken up the first*/p*
*p*I am in better spirits than I have been for Six months—all things are working around right*/p*
*p*I want you to send for the Mares and horses I have at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Cole*/person_mentioned*s*/location_mentioned* as soon as you can take care of them, tho When I see you we can arrange about that *person_mentioned*Emily */person_mentioned*has a -fine fat *person_mentioned*boy */person_mentioned*and all well—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sinse writing this *person_mentioned*Mrs Bradley*/person_mentioned* has had an application to stay up here some time longer,*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mr James F. Perry*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*pr. *person_mentioned*Joel*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
